title: Grease is getting a TV reboot set at Rydell High - 42 years after the movie
text:
The kids at Rydell High will be back and up to no good (Picture: Rex)

Grease is being given an all-singing, all-dancing series reboot 41 years after the original movie took the world by storm.

The new series will be set at Rydell High, and while it will feature some of the old characters, will instead focus on new ones and ‘reimagine the original movie’.

Whatever that means.

Called Grease: Rydell High, think of Glee set in the 50s and that’s pretty much what you’re going to get with this new take on the historical fave.

‘This is high school and life in small-town USA told on the scale of a big rock ‘n’ roll musical,’ said Sarah Aubrey, head of content at HBO Max.

‘It’s Grease 2.0 but with the same spirit, energy and excitement you immediately think of when you hear any of these iconic songs.’

The series comes 41 years after the film became iconic (Picture: Rex)

The series is still set back in the rock and roll era of decades gone by, and will feature big musical numbers, as well as new original songs.

Life will not be simple in Rydell High, with peer pressures of high school, pains of first love and puberty taking centre stage over exams.

HBO Max has already given the series a straight full-season order, and it looks like it will kick off next year – but a release date is not confirmed, and neither is a cast, episode count or episode length.

Rama-lama-lama Pink Ladies and T-Birds! What side are you on?

News of the movie comes six months after it was revealed that Paramount had laid down plans for a Summer Loving prequel to the original film as well.

Grease: Rydell High will be released next year on HBO Max.
